title: I'm A Celeb's Rita Simons was only allowed three pairs of knickers in jungle
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Rita Simons has lifted the lid on life on I’m A Celebrity, admitting she smuggled knickers into the jungle as they were only able to take three in.

Yes, seriously, three pairs of knickers for three weeks in the jungle.

We need a shower just thinking about it.

The EastEnders actress took part in last year’s instalment – which was later won by Harry Redknapp – and offered some advice to those heading down under.

During an appearance on Good Morning Britain, the 42-year-old instructed those starring on the show to take in more underwear.

Advertisement

When asked what advice she would give, she told Susanna Reid and Adil Ray: ‘Smuggle! What are they [producers] going to do?

Rita Simons was only allowed to take three pairs of knickers into I’m A Celeb (Picture: ITV)

‘I smuggled in extra knickers. You’re allowed three pairs of knickers… Three pairs. I smuggled more.’

Given the fact those three pairs of knickers probably get infested with various jungle bugs and critters the second a suitcase is opened, we’re totally on Rita’s side.

But that wasn’t the only item the Roxy Mitchell actress took into the jungle with her.

‘I smuggled a lighter, which got taken off me. Just in my pocket,’ she said.

She also smuggled in a lighter and gum (Picture: ITV)

‘Took a lighter, that got taken off of me. I took chewing gum, that got taken off of me.

‘I didn’t even know I had the chewing gum, they called me into the bush telegraph and said, “Have you got something in your pocket?” I said no…’

Kate Garraway, Richard Madeley and Love Island’s Amy Hart are just some of the famous faces linked to this year’s show, later this year.

Kate remained coy over her rumoured involvement, previously insisting she wouldn’t be able to talk about it.

Kate Garraway has been linked to a stint on I’m A Celebrity (Picture: Getty)

‘Even if I was doing it, I won’t be able to say I’m doing it. And even if I wasn’t doing it, I can’t say I’m not doing it,’ she said.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘It would be horrific. I don’t like heights, I don’t like the dark. I don’t like camping.

‘That is a good point actually, you can’t make a mess in the jungle because it’s already nature. I couldn’t be tidy in the jungle.

‘There’s nothing about the show I’d be good at.

Well, we might have to wait and see for ourselves…

Good Morning Britain continues on weekdays, at 6am, on ITV.
